JavaCool303

Class Cool303Container

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaCool303.Cool303Component
      • JavaCool303.Cool303Container
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cool303Box

    public class Cool303Container
extends Cool303Component
    A Cool303Container is a generic container, based around an AWT Container, that holds Cool303Components. The container is invisible, however, its contents are visible. A Cool303Container uses from AWT, a GridLayout, for its layout.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.awt.Container guiContainer 

      • Fields inherited from class JavaCool303.Cool303Component

        theme

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cool303Container(int rows, int cols, Cool303Theme theme)
      Constructs a new Cool303Container with its layout based upon Swing's Grid Layout

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addComponent(Cool303Component c)
      The 'addComponent' method inserts a Cool303Component at the next open position in the grid layout.
      void applyTheme()
      For a generic Cool303Container, this is a dummy method that is not implemented.
      protected java.awt.Component getSwingComponent()
      For the Swing components that lie underneath to be handled for collection and displaying in containers and whatnot, the 'getSwingComponent' acts as a secure unwrapping.
      void removeComponent(int index)
      The 'removeComponent' method removes the Cool303Component at the specified position.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • guiContainer

        protected java.awt.Container guiContainer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cool303Container

        public Cool303Container(int rows,
                        int cols,
                        Cool303Theme theme)
        Constructs a new Cool303Container with its layout based upon Swing's Grid Layout
        Parameters:
        rows - Number of rows in the container's layout
        cols - Number of columns in the container's layout
        theme - The Cool303Theme that all components within this container shall follow

    • Method Detail

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(Cool303Component c)
        The 'addComponent' method inserts a Cool303Component at the next open position in the grid layout. However, because of the nature of Swing, a Cool303Container may NOT contain a Cool303Frame, which is a JFrame wrapper.
        Parameters:
        c - Cool303Component to be added

      • removeComponent

        public void removeComponent(int index)
        The 'removeComponent' method removes the Cool303Component at the specified position. This method is a wrapper around the AWT Container method, 'remove(index)'.
        Parameters:
        index - The position of the Cool303Component to be removed

      • getSwingComponent

        protected java.awt.Component getSwingComponent()
        Description copied from class: Cool303Component
        For the Swing components that lie underneath to be handled for collection and displaying in containers and whatnot, the 'getSwingComponent' acts as a secure unwrapping.
        Specified by:
        getSwingComponent in class Cool303Component
        Returns:

      • applyTheme

        public void applyTheme()
        For a generic Cool303Container, this is a dummy method that is not implemented. This method is overridden by subclasses of Cool303Container, for whom, that container is shown.
        Specified by:
        applyTheme in class Cool303Component
